DataElement.preferredName: Gastrointestinal Tract Past Week How Often Swallowing Difficulty Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents how often during the past week swallowing difficulties occurred.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Gastrointestinal Tract Past Week How Often Swallowing Difficulty
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff._The most recent week, including today._A question about the frequency of an event or behavior._The act of passing something through the mouth and throat into the stomach._Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff.

Concepts.definition: The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff.
